TopicTitle: [1.2.0] Toolbar 1.7.13 - Common API for draggable/resizable buttons toolbar

Articles.Content:
9 hours ago, Apollo13 said:

Use the Settings button in the Blizzy Toolbar.  Left-click and drag the button to move.  When done, then click the Settings button again.

Could you please provide some screenshots?

The ‘Unlock button order’ button in the toolbar settings doesn’t work for folders, at least, for me.

Could you please provide some screenshots?

The ‘Unlock button order’ button in the toolbar settings doesn’t work for folders, at least, for me.

I misunderstood.  I thought you wanted to rearrange the buttons ingame.  Never mind
Update für 1.2.2 ?

It works.

I know you're only trying to help, but it still doesn't answer the question though.

XSparrow, no, there has not been an official update for 1.2.2. I can only guess the author thinks it's not needed. Good luck.

17 hours ago, OldLost said:

I know you're only trying to help, but it still doesn't answer the question though.

XSparrow, no, there has not been an official update for 1.2.2. I can only guess the author thinks it's not needed. Good luck.

It apparently is needed actually. (doing this since it wont let me insert an image).

2 hours ago, Wolfwood said:

It apparently is needed actually. (doing this since it wont let me insert an image).

Just because there's an error message doesn't mean it won't work

Seconded - you can safely ignore that warning.  The version checker is just a dumb bot - it just checks if the "approved for" version number in the mod is the same as the current version number. It doesn't do any sort of compatibility analysis.  In this case, the author never bothered to update that "approved for" field.

9 hours ago, Nansuchao said:

Lol, I didn't intend to sound rude. I just gave a simple answer to a simple question. I'm sorry if I was unclear or rude.

I thought you were entirely clear and usefully so (and not rude).

You can stop the error message by editing the "Toolbar.version" file to

 

...

"KSP_VERSION_MAX": {
        "MAJOR": 1,
        "MINOR": 2,
        "PATCH": 99,
        "BUILD": 0
    }
}

Hi, I got a small problem with the toolbar, I got the most recent version and I'm playing KSP 1.2.2

My problem:

I can use the toolbar everywhere exept the KSC-screen. It just wont appear there for me. It occasionaly does but - well that's not really a help.

Also when using mechjeb it sometimes won't show its buttons in flight but that could be a mj problem.

 

So, if someone can help it would be aprecciated.

cheers.

44 minutes ago, maculator said:

I can use the toolbar everywhere exept the KSC-screen

no problems here. Try a re-install

It was a fresh install with only mechjeb, x-science, module manager, waypointmanager, dockingport alignment indicator, alarmclock, custom config and rcs build aid (all freshly downloaded).

Only thing that's different is that I used my science szenario from a previous save to not loose my precious reports.

But I will test it on a really fresh install this evening and report back. And if it stil refuses to work I'll also provide logs of course.

cheers
@maculator you might also want to check toolbar-settings.dat in the GameData folder, perhaps the settings for SPACECENTER got borked.

Hmpf doesn't seem to work for me.

Edit:

[FIXED]

Fix: I went to the alarmclock settings and told her to only show in the toolbar, this made the icon appear. And after a hickup (didn't save position and moved it infront of the stocktoolbar) it now works.

Does anybody know?

 

Edit:

So by looking at the position of the toolbars I could tell that only the first one is the correct one and I deleted the others ... nothing dramatic happend

Hi, i have exactly the same problem here.

Don't know why exactly ...
You need a mod that is in the stock toolbar but can be switched to use blizzys.
Which "stock toolbar" in the menu ?

@msnbcorp What @maculator means is that you need to have mods installed that actually provide toolbar buttons. Toolbar is designed as to not appear in a scene (Space Center, Tracking Station, Flight/Map View) if there are no mods providing said buttons. A nice anti-cluttering feature.
Hun i think his response is more about the solution he found upper in the topic. Ok, but it's a vere temporary solution
Since Blizzy have not been here since 2016, no one wants to take the devs of his mod ?
